definition: to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
settlement
settler

sentences.english: They probably arrived in the United States with settlers and traders from Europe.
sentences.chinese: 它们可能是与定居者和商人一起从欧洲来到美国的。

sentences.english: In Hackney, by contrast, more people are both working and staying.
sentences.chinese: 与之相反，在哈克尼市，更多的人工作并定居于此。

sentences.english: They were traditionally semisedentary, moving seasonally between fixed sites.
sentences.chinese: 他们是传统的半定居部落，在定居点间季节性迁移。

sentences.english: They were traditionally semisedentary, moving seasonally between fixed sites.
sentences.chinese: 他们是传统的半定居部落，在定居点间季节性迁移。

sentences.english: There's an area called Yida where many of these refugees have settled.
sentences.chinese: 许多难民在玉达这一区域定居。

sentences.english: Defensibility is also taken into consideration when settling an area.
sentences.chinese: 定居地区还必须考虑到其防御性。

sentences.english: The settlers say terrorists hide among the trees.
sentences.chinese: 定居者说有恐怖分子藏在树丛里。

sentences.english: He later settled in Perpignan and grew vines.
sentences.chinese: 他后来定居佩皮尼昂，种植葡萄。
他们在得克萨斯州定居下来了。

sentences.english: The first white settlers traveled across America in wagons.
sentences.chinese: 第一批白人定居者横跨美洲大陆时乘的是四轮马车。

sentences.english: The first regional demarcations followed roughly the settlement patterns of various ethnic immigrant groups.
sentences.chinese: 最初的区域界限大体沿循各族裔移民群体的定居模式。

sentences.english: Living in the countryside was only Patricia's passing fancy.
sentences.chinese: 到乡村定居不过是帕里西夏一时兴起的想法。

sentences.english: Yet I wouldn’t rule out a little farmhouse should we someday choose to settle down.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我不排除有一天，我们应选择小农舍定居下来。

sentences.english: The aspect and slope of wasteland are important factors affecting plant colonization.
sentences.chinese: 废弃地的坡向和坡度也是影响植物定居的重要因子。

sentences.english: The size of those blocks and how Jerusalem might be shared has never been determined.
sentences.chinese: 那些定居点的规模以及将如何划分耶路撒冷仍未决定。

definition: to migrate/to move to a new place of residence
to move (from one residence to another)
to make one's home in a place/to settle
stable household, established profession (idiom); settled and comfortably off
to settle down/to set up a home
to reside/to dwell/to live in a place/resident in
to immigrate/to migrate/emigrant/immigrant
the whole family
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
to live in seclusion
to inhabit a region (esp. ethnic group)/to congregate
to move in (to new lodging)
to migrate/to move
to live in a foreign place/to live somewhere as a guest
ancestral home (town)/birthplace
to make one's home in/to reside in/to inhabit
